revised_title: Cytological Analysis of Somatic Hybrids in Lycopersicon Species
tldr: The authors conducted a detailed analysis of chromosome pairing at meiosis in pollen mother cells of somatic hybrids between Lycopersicon esculentum and Lycopersicon peruvianum. They found that the sets of chromosomes in the hybrids behaved independently, with some configurations more likely to occur in certain chromosome sets. This study has implications for the potential value of these hybrids in plant breeding.
